history.content:
Cracking The Coding Interview, LeetCode, and HackerRank.

There are tons of resources to prepare. But in my opinion, the best preparation is putting in the work. Take a week to study CCI, do some of the problems in the book. After that, do X amount of problems everyday from LeetCode, and take a look at HackerRank as well.

99% of the work will be by yourself. These clubs/resources that help with interview prep support lots of students, and so the amount they can help you is insignificant in the long run. UPE has mock interviews, doing 1-2 of those would help. However....you can just do that on your own with friends, without waiting for an open slot.

If you wants tips and tricks that aren't covered in the 3 resources above, i'm sure there are tons on YouTube.

My tips: Have a strongly formatted resume with content you're proud of and can talk about it. Also, try not to put languages/skills you don't like or don't know much about. In addition, don't worry about failing the interview, just focus on solving the problem and treating the interviewer as a friend who can help you with the problem.

You'll gain confidence with your awesome answers to the behavioral questions and will be more calm if you get stuck on a problem, and your interviewer might like that. I had an interview in which I didn't know how to answer some questions at all. I laughed and told the truth and asked for the answer. I ended up getting the offer and was told my lack of fear and great answers to the non-technical questions, as well as strongly formatted resume gave them confidence I could learn on the job.

Oh and to clarify, I got the main technical question correct, but I definitely asked a lot of clarifying questions during the process. The questions I failed were something along the lines of "do you know how X works in the real world". I've also sat in real interviews and culture fit and perseverance go a long way.

Strongly formatted resume = Make it as clean with the best descriptions possible. I had 0 internships, so I had to highlight other strengths and make it look nice. Took me about 15 iterations of peer and career center feedback.

----------------

UPE holds mock interviews at their office in 346 Soda Hall! They usually start a couple weeks into the semester, check https://upe.cs.berkeley.edu/interview/ for updates!

Hello, is there any club on campus that help us prepare for coding technical interviews?

Besides that, does anyone have recommendations about tips and resources to prepare for coding interviews?

Thank you
history.subject: interview preps
